newsitem.title: USA: U.S. cotton weekly export sales highlights--USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. cotton weekly export sales highlights--USDA.

text.p: USDA cotton export sales highlights in latest reporting week:
Net Upland sales of 62,800 running bales (RB) were 11 percent less than the previous week and 12 percent below than the 4-week average.

The major increases were for Turkey (18,700 RB), Mexico (9,900 RB), Taiwan (7,100 RB), and China (6,200 RB). Sales of 93,600 RB for delivery during the 1997/98 marketing year were primarily for Mexico (53,400 RB) and Japan (23,800 RB).

Exports of 161,300 RB exceeded the previous week by one-quarter and the 4-week average by one-fifth. Asian destinations accounted for 50 percent of the week's shipments; Western Hemisphere, 31 percent; and West European, 19 percent.
